notes:
Yes, for the coin toss section, please refer to the code changes in the 'CarnivalCoinToss.cs' script.  I have made some changes around line 85.  

- I have commented out the original line and tagged it with REMOVED.  I have also commented this code for clarity on what I was doing and why.   

- You will also see that I have left a couple of DEBUG lines in areas of this script.  In normal circumstances I would remove these on a production system or a release, but I have left these in here so that you could see that I was doing some debugging and tracing when working out my methodology for my code changes.
general_comment:
**Congratulations on creating your first VR project! **

You made a really amazing work in the script! As well, all games work perfectly!

Keep up the good work! 🌟

rubric.description: # Udacity Carnival ## Project Overview This project is a chance for students to have some fun playing around with the Unity Editor and practice getting what they build in Unity onto their smartphone. Students will be using Unity 5.6.1 patch 2, which you will need to grade them. The goal is to customize the **Udacity Carnival** project, which will be something cool that they can show off to their friends and family! The Udacity Carnival consists of 3 Mini-Games: Plinko, Wheel of Fortune, and Coin Toss. With each game, you earn points. When you earn 2000 points, you will receive a virtual classic Carnival prize! Currently in the starter project, the games are broken and it is up to students to fix them. Please refer to [the rubric](https://review.udacity.com/#!/rubrics/988/view) for tasks that students will be required to complete. The primary purpose of this project is for students to learn how to deploy a Unity project onto their phone. As always make sure to give students as much feedback as possible, but you can be lenient when grading and this will be reflected in the reviewer tips for each rubric item.
